text: Rhamphomyia marginata is a species of dance flies, in the fly family Empididae. It is found in Europe, from Great Britain east to Romania and from Fennoscandia south to France, Austria and Hungary. This species is unusual, though not unique, as it is the females, and not the males that swarm. ==References== ==External links== *Fauna Europaea Category:Empididae Category:Asilomorph flies of Europe Category:Insects described in 1787
title: Rhamphomyia marginata
